abilities.name: Energy Connect
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move a basic Energy card attached to 1 of your Benched Pokémon to your Active Pokémon. This power can't be used if Ampharos is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Miraculous Thunder
attacks.text: You may discard all Lightning Energy attached to Ampharos. If you do, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned and Confused.

attacks.name: Reactive Poison
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 30 more damage for each Special Condition affecting the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Spider Trap
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned. Before applying this effect, you may switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. If you do, the new Defending Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned. Your opponent chooses the Defending Pokémon to switch.

attacks.name: Green Dance
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Grass Pokémon, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. If you put any Grass Pokémon into your hand, you may switch Bellossom with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Full Bloom
attacks.text: If you have at least 3 Bellossom in play, this attack does 50 damage plus 50 more damage.

abilities.name: Intimidating Fang
abilities.text: As long as Feraligatr is your Active Pokémon, any damage done by an opponent's attack is reduced by 10 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Pull Away
attacks.text: If your opponent has 5 of more cards in his or her hand, your opponent discards a number of cards until your opponent has 4 cards left in his or her hand.

attacks.name: Tonnage
attacks.text: You may do 50 damage plus 30 more damage. If you do, Feraligatr does 30 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Fire Dance
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for a Fire Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Multi Burn
attacks.text: If Flareon has 3 or more different types of basic Energy cards attached to it, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Spiky Shell
attacks.text: Put 3 damage counters on the Defending Pokémon at the end of your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Pop
attacks.text: Put 7 damage counters on Forretress. Move all Energy cards attached to Forretress to your Benched Pokémon in any way you like. (Ignore this effect if you don't have any Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Lonesome
abilities.text: As long as you have less Pokémon in play than your opponent, your opponent can't play any Trainer cards (except for Supporter cards) from his or her hand.

attacks.name: Tight Jaw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy attached to Houndoom.

attacks.name: Attract Current
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Multi Pulse
attacks.text: If Jolteon has 3 of more different types of basic Energy cards attached to it, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

abilities.name: Healing Aroma
abilities.text: As long as Meganium is your Active Pokémon, remove 1 damage counter from each Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex) (both yours and your opponent's) between turns.

attacks.name: Bouncy Move
attacks.text: You may put up to 5 damage counters on Meganium. If you do, this attack does 50 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter you put on Meganium in this way.

abilities.name: Super Suction Cups
abilities.text: As long as Octillery is your Active Pokémon, your opponent's Pokémon can't retreat.

attacks.name: Standing By
attacks.text: Discard an Energy card attached to Octillery. During your next turn, Octillery's Pulse Blast attack's base damage is 120.

abilities.name: Spiral Swirl
abilities.text: If Poliwrath is your Active Pokémon and is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, the Attacking Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Beatdown
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Darkness Pokémon or has Dark in its name, this attack does 40 damage plus 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Hyper Splash
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Stage 2 Evolved Pokémon, this attack does 60 damage plus 30 more damage.

abilities.name: 3-D Reset
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), return a Pokémon Tool card attached to 1 of your Pokémon to your hand. This power can't be used if Porygon2 is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Data Retrieval
attacks.text: If you have less than 8 cards in your hand, draw cards until you have 8 cards in your hand.

attacks.name: Scramble Trip
attacks.text: If Porygon2 has a Scramble Energy card attached to it, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

abilities.name: Dual Armor
abilities.text: As long as Slowbro has any Psychic Energy attached to it, Slowbro is both Water and Psychic type.

attacks.name: Parallel Gain
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter from each of your Pokémon (including Slowbro).

abilities.name: Item Search
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a Pokémon Tool card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Slowking is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Aftermath
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Pokémon Tool card in your discard pile. You can't add more than 60 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Copy
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. Copy copies that attack. This attack does nothing if Sudowoodo doesn't have the Energy necessary to use that attack. (You must still do anything else required for that attack.) Sudowoodo performs that attack.

attacks.name: Dazzle Dance
attacks.text: Each Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Green Blast
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Grass Energy attached to all of your Pokémon.

abilities.name: Burning Aura
abilities.text: As long as Typhlosion is your Active Pokémon, put 1 damage counter on each Active Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) between turns.

attacks.name: Flickering Flames
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: Does 50 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Typhlosion.

abilities.name: Intimidating Ring
abilities.text: As long as Ursaring is your Active Pokémon, your opponent's Basic Pokémon can't attack or use any Poké-Powers.

attacks.name: Drag Off
attacks.text: Before doing damage, you may switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with the Defending Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 20 damage to the new Defending Pokémon. Your opponent chooses the Defending Pokémon to switch.

attacks.name: Rock Smash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Aqua Supply
attacks.text: You may attach a basic Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Multi Bubble
attacks.text: If Vaporeon has 3 or more different types of basic Energy cards attached to it, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Hyper Healing
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter and all Special Conditions from each of your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Double Tack
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each Defending Pokémon.

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Clefairy from your hand onto Cleffa (this counts as evolving Cleffa) and remove all damage counters from Cleffa.

attacks.name: Eeeeeeek
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck, then draw 6 cards.

abilities.name: Stages of Evolution
abilities.text: As long as Electabuzz is an Evolved Pokémon, any damage done to Electabuzz by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon that has any Special Energy cards attached to it is reduced by 40 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Double Shock
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads. If either of the coins is heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Luster Blast
attacks.text: Discard 3 Energy attached to Electabuzz.

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Electabuzz from your hand onto Elekid (this counts as evolving Elekid) and remove all damage counters from Elekid.

attacks.name: Magnetic Trip
attacks.text: If Low Pressure System is in play, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

abilities.name: Stages of Evolution
abilities.text: As long as Hitmonchan is an Evolved Pokémon, Hitmonchan gets +30 HP.

attacks.name: Heavy Punch
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Speedy Uppercut
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

abilities.name: Stages of Evolution
abilities.text: As long as Hitmonlee is an Evolved Pokémon, Hitmonlee's attacks do 20 more damage to your opponent's Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Stretch Kick
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Stages of Evolution
abilities.text: As long as Hitmontop is an Evolved Pokémon, is your Active Pokémon, and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Hitmontop is Knocked Out), put 2 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Upward Kick
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has at least 2 damage counters on it, this attack does 20 damage plus 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Sacred Fire
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 60 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

abilities.name: Stages of Evolution
abilities.text: As long as Jynx is an Evolved Pokémon, prevent all effects of opponent's attacks, except damage, done to Jynx, and Jynx has no Weakness.

attacks.name: Freeze Light
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Pure Power
attacks.text: Put 4 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Aeroblast
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Night Song
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. Your opponent chooses the Defending Pokémon to switch. The new Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Plunder
attacks.text: Before doing damage, discard all Trainer cards attached to the Defending Pokémon.

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Jynx from your hand onto Smoochum (this counts as evolving Smoochum) and remove all damage counters from Smoochum.

attacks.name: Blown Kiss
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Screechy Voice
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is an Evolved Pokémon, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Push Away
attacks.text: Look at your opponent's hand, choose a Trainer card you find there, and discard it.

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Hitmonlee, Hitmonchan, or Hitmontop from your hand onto Tyrogue (this counts as evolving Tyrogue) and remove all damage counters from Tyrogue.

attacks.name: Desperate Punch
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of Pokémon in play your opponent has more than you.

abilities.name: Snappy Move
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Aipom is on your Bench, you may draw a card. Then, discard all cards attached to Aipom and put Aipom on the bottom of your deck. You can't use more than 1 Snappy Move Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Snap Tail
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Soothing Scent
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Shining Fingers
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Extra Comet Punch
attacks.text: During your next turn, Extra Comet Punch does 30 damage plus 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Cry for Help
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Water or Fighting Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex), show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Double Attack
attacks.text: Choose 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Aqua Sonic
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

abilities.name: Intimidating Fang
abilities.text: As long as Granbull is your Active Pokémon, any damage done by an opponent's attack is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Crushing Blow
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Double Lariat
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Energy Stream
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for a basic Energy card and attach it to Lanturn.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: Lanturn does 10 damage to itself.

abilities.name: Dual Armor
abilities.text: As long as Magcargo has any Fighting Energy attached to it, Magcargo is both Fire and Fighting type.

attacks.name: Smokescreen
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Extra Flame
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Pokémon-ex, this attack does 40 damage plus 30 more damage.

abilities.name: Thick Fat
abilities.text: Any damage done to Miltank by attacks from Fire Pokémon and Water Pokémon is reduced by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Healing Milk
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, remove 2 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Spearhead
attacks.text: Draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Surprise
attacks.text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking. Look at the card you chose, then have your opponent shuffle that card into his or her deck.

abilities.name: Dense
abilities.text: Any damage done to Quagsire by attacks from your opponent's Evolved Pokémon is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Rock Hurl
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Smokescreen
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Twin Play
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 in any combination of Scyther and Scyther ex and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Scyther during your opponent's next turn.

abilities.name: Extra-tight
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to Shuckle by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon-ex.

attacks.name: Toxic
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 2 damage counters instead of 1 on the Defending Pokémon between turns.

abilities.name: Makeover
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a basic Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex). If you do, search your discard pile for a basic Energy card (excluding the one you discarded) and attach it to that Pokémon. This power can't be used if Smeargle is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Split Spiral Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Telekinesis
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Grand Loop
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards. You may switch Yanma with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Spinning Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Thunder Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Lullaby
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Paralyzing Gaze
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Fireworks
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard a Fire Energy card attached to Cyndaquil.

abilities.name: Energy Evolution
abilities.text: Whenever you attach an Energy card from your hand to Eevee, you may search your deck for a card that evolves from Eevee that is the same type as the Energy card you attached to Eevee. Put that card onto Eevee. (This counts as evolving Eevee.) Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used when you attach an Energy card to Eevee as part of an attack's effect.

attacks.name: Thunder Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Thunder
attacks.text: Flaaffy does 10 damage to itself.

abilities.name: Free Flight
abilities.text: If Gligar has no Energy cards attached to it, Gligar's Retreat Cost is 0.

attacks.name: Toxic Grip
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Smog
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Retaliate
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Larvitar.

attacks.name: Telekinesis
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

attacks.name: Stun Spore
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Dig Deep
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for an Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand.

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Energy Ball
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to Poliwhirl but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Fishing Tail
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for a Basic Pokémon, Evolution card, or basic Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand.

attacks.name: Trip Over
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage.

attacks.name: Yawn
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Lick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Stun Poison
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Minor Errand-Running
attacks.text: Search your deck for a basic Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Teary Eyes
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Teddiursa by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Splatter
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

name: Curse Powder
rules: If the Pokémon that Curse Powder is attached to is your Active Pokémon and is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, put 3 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

name: Energy Recycle System
rules: Choose 1:• Put a basic Energy card from your discard pile into your hand.• Shuffle 3 basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your deck.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Energy Removal 2
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 Energy card attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon and discard it.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Energy Root
rules: As long as Energy Root is attached to a Pokémon, that Pokémon gets +20 HP and can't use any Poké-Powers or Poké-Bodies.

name: Energy Switch
rules: Move a basic Energy from 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Fluffy Berry
rules: As long as Fluffy Berry is attached to a Pokémon, that Pokémon's Retreat Cost is 0.

name: Mary's Request
rules: Draw a card. If you don't have any Stage 2 Evolved Pokémon in play, draw 2 more cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Poké Ball
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Pokémon Reversal
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch it with your opponent's Active Pokémon.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Professor Elm's Training Method
rules: Search your deck for an Evolution card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Protective Orb
rules: As long as Protective Orb is attached to a Pokémon, that Pokémon has no Weakness.

name: Sitrus Berry
rules: At the end of each turn, if the Pokémon this card is attached to has 3 or more damage counters on it, heal 30 damage from it and discard this card.

name: Solid Rage
rules: If you have more Prize cards left than your opponent, the Pokémon that Solid Rage is attached to does 20 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Warp Point
rules: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with his or her Active Pokémon, then, if you have any Benched Pokémon, you switch 1 of them with your Active Pokémon.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Energy Search
rules: Search your deck for a Basic Energy card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Potion
rules: Heal 30 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Metal Energy
rules: Damage done by attacks to the Pokémon that Metal Energy is attached to is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance). Ignore this effect if the Pokémon that Metal Energy is attached to isn't Metal. Metal Energy provides Metal Energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

name: Cyclone Energy
rules: This card provides Colorless Energy. When you play this card from your hand and attach it to your Active Pokémon, your opponent switches his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

name: Warp Energy
rules: This card provides Colorless Energy.When you attach this card from your hand to your Active Pokémon, switch that Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

abilities.name: Blissful Support
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you play Blissey ex from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may discard all Energy cards attached to any number of your Pokémon and remove all damage counters from those Pokémon.

attacks.name: Energy Absorption
attacks.text: Attach up to 3 Energy cards from your discard pile to Blissey ex.

abilities.name: Devo Flash
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you play Espeon ex from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may choose 1 Evolved Pokémon on your opponent's Bench, remove the highest Stage Evolution card from that Pokémon, and put it back into his or her hand.

attacks.name: Snap Tail
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Psyloop
attacks.text: Does 60 damage plus 30 more damage for each Trainer card your opponent has in play.

abilities.name: Overpowering Fang
abilities.text: As long as Feraligatr ex is your Active Pokémon, each player's Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex) can't use any Poké-Powers or Poké-Bodies.

attacks.name: Tsunami
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Sore Spot
attacks.text: Does 70 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

abilities.name: Golden Wing
abilities.text: If Ho-Oh ex would be Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, you may move up to 2 Energy attached to Ho-Oh ex to your Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Rainbow Burn
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 20 more damage for each type of basic Energy card attached to Ho-Oh ex.

abilities.name: Silver Sparkle
abilities.text: If Lugia ex is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Lugia ex is Knocked Out), flip a coin. If heads, choose an Energy card attached to the Attacking Pokémon and return it to your opponent's hand.

attacks.name: Elemental Blast
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy, Water Energy, and Lightning Energy attached to Lugia ex.

abilities.name: Nurture and Heal
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Grass Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon. If you do, remove 1 damage counter from that Pokémon. This power can't be used if Meganium ex is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Power Poison
attacks.text: Discard 1 Energy attached to Meganium ex. The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Upward Lick
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. If that Pokémon is a Stage 2 Evolved Pokémon, this attack does 50 damage instead. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Punch and Run
attacks.text: Switch Politoed ex with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Swallow Up
attacks.text: Before doing damage, count the remaining HP of the Defending Pokémon and Politoed ex. If the Defending Pokémon has fewer remaining HP than Politoed ex's, this attack does 120 damage instead.

abilities.name: Danger Perception
abilities.text: As long as Scizor ex's remaining HP is 60 or less, Scizor ex does 40 more damage to the Defending Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Steel Wing
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Scizor ex by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Cross-Cut
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is an Evolved Pokémon, this attack does 50 damage plus 30 more damage.

abilities.name: Poison Resistance
abilities.text: Steelix ex can't be Poisoned.

attacks.name: Metal Charge
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on Steelix ex.

attacks.name: Mudslide
attacks.text: Discard 2 Fighting Energy attached to Steelix ex and choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 100 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Bursting Up
abilities.text: Once during your turn when you play Typhlosion ex from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, count the number of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. You may search your deck for up to that number of Fire Energy cards and attach them to 1 of your Fire Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Kindle
attacks.text: Discard an Energy card attached to Typhlosion ex and then discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Shatter
attacks.text: Discard any Stadium card in play.

attacks.name: Derail
attacks.text: Discard a Special Energy card, if any, attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Mix-Up
attacks.text: Your opponent discards the top card of his or her deck.

attacks.name: Losing Control
attacks.text: Discard the top 3 cards of your deck.

abilities.name: Darker Ring
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), when you play Umbreon ex from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. Your opponent chooses the Defending Pokémon to switch.

attacks.name: Black Cry
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat or use any Poké-Powers during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Burning Turn
attacks.text: Switch Entei Star with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Detonation
attacks.text: If you have less Prize cards left than your opponent, discard the top 10 cards from your deck.

attacks.name: Lightning Turn
attacks.text: Switch Raikou Star with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Meta Voltage
attacks.text: If you have less Prize cards left than your opponent, this attack does 40 damage to each of your Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Splashing Turn
attacks.text: Switch Suicune Star with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Cross Wind
attacks.text: If you have less Prize cards left than your opponent, discard all Energy cards attached to all of your Pokémon.

abilities.name: Night Cry
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if Rocket's Persian ex is on your Bench, you may search your deck for a Pokémon with Dark or Rocket's in its name. Show it to your opponent and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Toxic Claws
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 2 damage counters instead of 1 on the Defending Pokémon between turns.

attacks.name: Spiral Leaf
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokémon. If tails, remove 1 damage counter from each of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Time Trap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, look at the top 4 cards of your opponent's deck, and put them back on top of your opponent's deck in any order. If tails, look at the top 4 cards of your deck, and put them back on top of your deck in any order.
